name: contemporarily
content:
contemporarily adverb
(IN A MODERN WAY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the present time: Men dressed in medieval costume shared the stage with contemporarily clothed dancers. Her aim was to make classical literature contemporarily relevant.
More examplesFewer examplesEven a contemporarily minded orchestra may neglect some of the outstanding compositions of its era.Most people tend to look at things contemporarily rather than historically.The museum is attempting to present the history of the building in a contemporarily relevant and entertaining way.

contemporarily adverb
(AT THE SAME PERIOD/TIME)
in a way that happens at the same time, or among the people who lived at the same period of time: His letters show that he had little respect for most of the contemporarily popular writers. Contemporarily, the earl was acclaimed for maintaining peace in the region. The amount of data that can be handled contemporarily is limited.
